payload.title: A quiz about sugar!
payload.description: Let's check we know about sugar!

payload.title: When it comes to sugar, how much should we be having?

The correct answer is C. Aim to reduce sugar intake as much as we can about 80% of the time. There’s no gram limit per day, nor are we saying you can’t ever have sugar again! We want you to get away with as much as you can in this life without it affecting your PCOS! Unfortunately, when our insulin isn’t functioning properly eating sugar has a big impact on our insulin levels, so we need to reduce sugar as much as possible (most of the time) to help maintain a stable blood sugar and support our
b. Sugar from fruits only are allowed
c. Aim to reduce sugar intake as much as we can about 80% of the time
If we’re making low sugar baking, what is the best sweetener to use?

The correct answer is c. sugar alcohols. This is as they have the same sweetness and properties as normal table sugar, so the baking isn’t affected. Sugar alcohols are a category of sweet carbohydrates found naturally (aim for these where possible), or processed from other sugars, but these also don’t raise insulin levels (they still have calories and carbohydrates however). Both honey and cane sugar contain high levels of sugar so would mean the baking is no longer ‘low sugar’, but rather norma
Sleep!
payload.description: A little quiz to check how much you can recall about sleep!

payload.title: How many hours of sleep do most people need each night to function well?

The correct answer is C. 7-9 hours of sleep each night. There is no ‘one size fits all’, but for the majority of the population between 7 and 9 hours is necessary to feel properly rested, and achieve quality sleep.
What percentage of the population can function with just 6 hours of sleep each night?

The correct answer is D. 5% of the population. Only about 5% of the population have the genetic make-up that means their body can function from just 6 hours of sleep per night. For the rest of us, 6 hours isn’t enough to achieve the rest and recovery our body and brain requires after each day.
Period chat!
payload.description: Let's test our knowledge on what a period should look like!

payload.title: How many days should a period last for?

The correct answer is C. Between 2-7 days, but most commonly between 3-5 days with some spotting either side. One of these days must have proper flow, it cannot be spotting only. Longer than 7 days signals intermenstrual bleeding or an anovulatory cycle.
How do you know what day is a ‘period’ day (has proper flow) and what is just spotting?
The correct answer is A. You should need to use at least 2 pads or tampons on a day with a proper flow.
a. You should need to use at least 2 pads or tampons
b. You can get away with only using underwear/panty liners
c. You will have only used one pads or tampon within the day
Which of these are we NOT looking at when we look at sperm in a clinical semen analysis?

The correct (but incorrect) answer is motivation. Although we do hope the sperm is motivated, we can't determine this from a clinical analysis. Instead we can see the motility, mobility and concentration of the sperm in the semen.
In an extensive review of the literature, how much was infertility found to be due to male factor fertility?

The correct answer is a. 50% of infertility is due to male infertility. This is why having a sperm analysis done early in the stages of trying to conceive is a good idea. Doing this earlier means you can focus on making changes at the same time rather than waiting 6-12 months down the road only to find more work needs to be done.
Do you need to get a blood test before supplementing with iron, vitamin D and zinc?

<body>
The correct answer is A. Yes. This is because your current levels of
these nutrients will inform whether you require supplementation or
not, and how much. Our bodies struggle to excrete (get rid of)
excess amounts of these nutrients, so they can build up and become
toxic for us. To avoid this, we always need to test that our levels
aren’t too high. If we’re low or deficient in these nutrients, we
can use our test results to guide how much we need to supplement to
get us back to our functi
Select the two types of foods that our brains associate with survival and therefore crave when we’re hungry?

The correct answers are a and b. High carbohydrate / sugar and high
fat foods. This is because carbohydrates (sugar specifically) are
fast-acting fuels, meaning our bodies can utilize these for energy
quickly. They also crave high fat foods as these are the most
energy-dense foods as fat has significantly higher calories per gram
than both carbohydrates and proteins. Balanced meals and foods rich
in protein and non-starchy vegetables are just as capable of
delivering us the energy we need, howev
What are the problems you struggle with when it comes to your sleep?
Problem #4 - “My sleeping problems happen the week before my period”
Problem #5 - “I struggle to get to sleep or stay asleep constantly”
Problem #6 - I feel myself getting excessively sleepy during the day, and I can snore loudly
White light can affect our natural melatonin production, which can interfere with our natural sleepiness signals. What can we do to reduce the effect of white light on our sleep?
The correct answer is D. All of the above can help reduce the white light we experience in the lead up to sleep.
a. Put our devices to sleep 30 minutes before we put ourselves to bed
b. Create a dark room environment (dim lights, black out curtains)
c. Create a wind-down routine to prepare for sleep
You’re feeling anxious or stressed and you can’t get to sleep. What is something you could do to alleviate your feelings of stress?
The correct answer is A. Keep a pen and paper on your bedside table to note down anything you’re worrying about. This can help remove the stress that you’ll forget about it.
a. Keep a pen and paper on your bedside table to note down anything you’re worrying about
b. Think about it more so that it might go away
What’s the best exercise for me?

The correct answer is E. All of the above. The best exercise is one that you will continue to do for life, so enjoyment is key! It shouldn’t leave you feeling terribly tired but motivated and energised, and it can help to build strength and flexibility in your muscles and can even improve your balance. Sign us up!
b. One that makes me feel energised
c. One that strengthens my muscles
d. One that helps my flexibility and balance

The correct answer is D. A way to build muscle strength through continuing to increase the intensity of the reps you’re doing. It is a technique to build strength during resistance training. This might be through increasing your reps, the weights you use, slowing down reps to build more tension in the muscle, or incorporating pulses or shortening your period to rest between sets. You don’t need weight equipment as you can use rep timing or rest periods to progressively overload your body weight
a. Doing the exact same exercise circuit each week
b. An exercise that can only be done with weights equipment
c. A type of HIIT exercise
d. A way to build muscle strength through continuing to increase the intensity of the reps you’re doing
Which of the following is not a type of low intensity cardio exercise?
The correct answer is E, as weight-lifting falls under resistance training. Jogging, brisk walking, swimming and dancing are all great options of low intensity cardio exercise.
Carbohydrates
payload.description: A quiz to reinforce our learnings on carbs!

payload.title: Which statement is not true about carbohydrates and your root cause?

The correct (or incorrect in this case) answer is D. You shouldn’t
eat carbohydrates at breakfast due to your insulin. This is
incorrect as insulin is not the root cause for your PCOS (despite
this being the case for 80% of people with PCOS). Instead, it’s
important to include carbohydrates at breakfast when stress hormones
are at play, as skipping an entire food group, in this case carbs,
can increase our cortisol levels which in turn further affects our
hormones that govern ovulation and driv
a. Reduced carbohydrates can increase our cortisol levels
b. Reduced carbohydrates can cause amenorrhea (loss of periods)
c. At least 30% of your daily calories should come from carbohydrates
You shouldn’t eat carbohydrates at breakfast due to your insulin
How does exercise make you feel?
Which of these best resonate with how exercise makes you feel?
Awesome, we love that! Keep this in mind next time you’re feeling a little sluggish, or when you need some workout motivation!
Awesome, we love that! Keep this in mind next time you feel a little stressed or irritated, or when you need some workout motivation!
Awesome, we love that! Keep this in mind next time you feel like you’re pushing sand up a hill and need something to go your way! Or when you need some workout motivation!
Awesome, we love that! Keep this in mind next time you need some workout motivation!
If you find you’re still quite exhausted 15 minutes after you finish your workout you might be overdoing it. You should have recovered from the exertion of the workout within about 10 minutes.
All About Breakfast Quiz
payload.description: Let's recap on what we've learnt about breakfast!

payload.title: How much protein are we aiming for at breakfast?

The correct answer is D. 40-50g of protein at breakfast as this is the amount that we’ve found is best for stabilizing your blood sugar. As a bonus it also keeps you fuller for longer and gives you more stable energy throughout the day!
When do we suggest eating breakfast?

The correct answer is B. Within 1 hour of waking. This is as the research shows us that consuming food shortly after we wake can positively affect impact things like our testosterone levels, sex hormone binding globulin (SHBG), insulin and ovulation. Within an hour of waking is the most effective (and realistic) time to eat within.
d. There is no time limit
Protein Powder Quiz
payload.description: Let's see what we've learnt about protein powders!

payload.title:
Unsweetened protein is the best option, but if we’re opting for a flavoured, sweetened powder what is the best to go for?
Cane sugar
The correct answer is D. sweeteners like stevia, monk fruit or thaumatin as these sweeteners come from a natural source and don’t stimulate insulin.
d. Natural sweeteners like stevia, monk fruit or thaumatin
How many grams of carbohydrates are we aiming for our protein to be under per serve?

The correct answer is D. less than 2g. We suggest a low carbohydrate option at breakfast as we’re limiting our carbohydrate intake at breakfast to avoid a big insulin spike in the morning. Under 4g per serve is okay, but under 2g is best.
If you were out for coffee with friends, and looking to reduce your dairy intake, what would be the best alternative milk choice to go for?
The correct answer is B unsweetened almond milk. This is because unsweetened almond milk (or another unsweetened nut milk) will be the least insulin-stimulating, as well as a dairy-free option.
d. Soy milk (could be sweetened, it’s hard to tell!)
Which of the following are the least insulin-stimulating of dairy foods?

The correct answer is D. hard cheddar cheese. This is because it is harder cheese, along with other higher fat dairy products like butter and cream (in small quantities) has shown to have less of an effect on our insulin.
d. Small amounts of hard cheddar cheese
Breakfast Quiz
payload.description: A quiz to recap what we've learnt about breakfast!

payload.title: How much protein are we aiming for at breakfast?

The correct answer is C. 30-40g of protein at breakfast as this is the amount that we’ve found is best for improving our energy throughout the day to avoid 3pm energy slumps, sugar cravings and hangry attacks. As a bonus it also keeps you fuller for longer and gives you more stable energy throughout the day!
What’s a good example of a complex carb?
The correct answer is A. wholegrain oats. Wholegrain oats are a complex carb because they are slowly broken down by your body which helps keep your energy more stable for longer.
When do we suggest eating breakfast?

The correct answer is B. Within an hour of waking. This is as the research shows us that consuming food shortly after we wake can positively affect impact things like our testosterone levels, sex hormone binding globulin (SHBG), insulin and ovulation. Within an hour of waking is the most effective (and realistic) time to eat within.
d. There is no time limit
Lunch and Dinner Quiz!
payload.description: A quick recap on lunch and dinner!

payload.title: What makes a meal nutritionally balanced?

The correct answer is B. It has plenty of veggies, as well as a portion of carbs and protein, as well as some healthy fats. This is because our bodies need all of these macronutrients to function optimally. Whole foods like veggies, meats, whole grains and fruits also deliver plenty of vitamins, minerals, antioxidants and fiber which also are important for our body. A varied and balanced meal is the best way to fuel our body and get a range of nutrients.
a. Even distribution of food across the plate
b. It has plenty of veggies, as well as a portion of carbs and protein, as well as some healthy fats from whole foods
c. It has no carbs, but plenty of fats and proteins
d. It has no fat, but plenty of carbs and protein
Why do we have carbohydrates at lunch and dinner?

The correct answer is D. All of the above. Carbohydrates are an extremely important nutrient for our bodies, and are our body’s main source of energy. We only recommend eating little to no carbs at breakfast, as this has shown to have a big impact on our blood sugar stability across the rest of the day. We do encourage you to eat a moderate portion of carbohydrates in your lunch and dinner meals as a part of a balanced meal, as protein, fat and veggies can help reduce the effect on our insulin.
a. Because carbohydrates are an important fuel or energy source for our brains and muscles
b. Because carbohydrates, when eaten with veggies, proteins and fats have less of an effect on our insulin and blood sugars
c. Because we don’t advocate a ‘no carb’ diet

The correct answer is E. All of the above. We look to non-starchy veggies for variety in our diet, to help fill us up and provide us with plenty of essential nutrients like vitamins, minerals and fiber.
Which meals should we aim to include non-starchy vegetables in?

The correct answer is C. As many meals as possible (including snacks). We aim to have some non-starchy veggies in as many meals as we can to help keep us feeling full and deliver us plenty of nutritional goodness. They also taste delicious!
c. As many meals as possible (including snacks)
Mindful Eating Quiz
payload.description: Let's test your knowledge on mindful eating!

payload.title: Which of the below is NOT practised when mindful eating?

The correct answer is C. Using devices to search the internet during meal times distract us from the task of eating. We suggest trying device-free meal times to avoid the temptation of searching or scrolling!
a. Putting down the knife and fork between bites
b. Speaking to the person you’re eating with
d. Noticing how the food crunches when you bite
